post_text: November 19, 2015 at 3:09 PM#1Hey GuysI am sorry if this has been discussed before, but I can't seem to figure out, how to make a simple Macro that will enable and disable the MSC midi input.It is of course possible in the Midi Show Control menu, but I would really like to have a quicker way of doing it, when I and the sound guy are working on cues at the same time, and I don't want him to trigger my cues by accident.And yes, I could just pull out the cable, but I am hoping that there is a "smarter" way of doing it, sitting in front of an MA2 desk

posts.author: Duplicate Ryan Kanarek
posts.post_text: November 19, 2015 at 3:24 PM#2Line 1: [color=#66FF00]Assign Root[/color] settings.midiconfig /mscinmode=disabled (wait = Go)Line 2: [color=#66FF00]Assign Root[/color] settings.midiconfig /mscinmode=midiEDIT: if you were doing it via Ethernet instead, then you would just swap =midi for =ethernet
